titles.title: To expand the Tree Assistance Program of the Department of Agriculture to assist agriculture producers to pay the costs of replanting commercially grown trees and seedlings, ornamental plants, and other perennial plants that are destroyed by damaging weather or related condition and to change the manner of determining crop yields for trees and seedlings, ornamental plants, and other perennial plants for purposes of emergency crop loss assistance.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Specialty Crops and Natural Resources.

bill.summary: 3/24/1994--Introduced. Amends the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to expand forest crop emergency disaster assistance to include commercially grown ornamental or other perennial plants.
